intro: Lindernia glabra, commonly known as the smooth lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in the spring and early summer. Lindernia glabra is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
